trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Document"></xref> control types to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)].
The DocumentAutomationPeer represents documents and supports the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Objects such as a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument> can contain embedded objects, such as images and hyperlinks.

Initially, when you try to get the child elements of the document, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer.GetChildrenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName> does not return the embedded objects.

To get the embedded elements, obtain a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange> from the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> and call <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetChildren%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

After <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetChildren%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is called, any elements in that <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange> are returned by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer.GetChildrenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

> [!NOTE] > Unless you know the document is a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument>, you should not call <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetChildren%2A> on the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.DocumentRange%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the document is loaded from a network location, calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetChildren%2A> on the entire document is resource intensive.

Instead, you should use one of the methods on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> that returns a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange> that represents a portion of the document.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Gets the control type for the control that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType*>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType"></xref> in all cases.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the screen coordinates of the element that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle*>.
The bounding rectangle.

Gets the collection of child elements for the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*>.

Because <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref> gives access to its content through <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern"></xref>, this method always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName*>.
A string that contains "Document".

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the clickable space that is on the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint*>.
The point that represents the clickable space that is on the element.
Gets the control pattern for the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref>.
One of the enumeration values.
If patternInterface is , this method returns an .

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref> is understood by the end user as interactive or the user might understand the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)].
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref> is off the screen.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen*>.
This property does not indicate whether the element is visible.
In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible.
For example, if the element is obscured by other elements, it might not be visible.
In this case, the method returns `false`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
